intro: Hippomarathrum amplifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf hippomarathrum, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as succulent leaves and deep root systems to conserve water. Its foliage is broad and fleshy, often covered in a waxy cuticle to reduce water loss. The showy yellow flowers appear in the summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
